page.title: 07Ditton Church Centre
page.content: 1853 saw the building of Ditton Church School with an enlargement in 1887 by the Brassey family for Queen Victoria's Jubilee. In 1983 the building was handed over to Rochester Diocese. (Due to a fall in the birth rate the new school buildings could accommodate all pupils). The Diocese let the building to Ditton P.C.C. at a peppercorn rent for an unstated period and planning permission was obtained for its conversion to a Church Centre to replace that in Bell Lane. Under the supervision of Alan Hall and the Youth Training Scheme the conversion resulted in a lounge, kitchen and hall. The official opening by Maureen and Alan Hall was on 1st July 1984 and since that time the Centre has been used by various Youth and Church organisations.
